plugins.name: Lineage
plugins.description:
Visualize your component and style dependencies.

Lineage helps you understand how your design system is being used and how every change impacts your project.

To use: 
1. Select a frame/component 
2. Run Lineage
3. Explore the graph, click on your nodes and find details about their dependencies
4. (Optional) If you click on the "Show all instances" button, the graph will display every use of that specific style/component throughout your document

This is version 1.0, more to come.
Please, if you have any suggestion or issue, reach out on Twitter @lalomts

plugins.name: Design version
plugins.description:
Design Version transforms the way designers manage and document revisions in their projects or libraries. With Design Version, users can create detailed changelogs directly in Figma, enhancing traceability and collaboration within design teams.


NEW 🔥


Release Candidates

Easily create and manage release candidates for your design iterations.


Description Links

Add hyperlinks to your design descriptions for enhanced navigation and context.


Revamped UI

Experience a sleek, new user interface for improved usability.


Dark Mode

Enjoy a visually comfortable dark mode for reduced eye strain.



ALL THE FEATURES ✨


Custom Change Records

Describe changes made to your designs clearly and concisely. Add details, links and explanations for each modification, improving communication within your team.


Figma Version History

Each changelog entry is also saved in Figma's version history, allowing designers to revert to any previous instance of the design. This feature is crucial for retrieving past versions or comparing design evolutions.


Flexible Versioning

Choose between two versioning methods for your designs:

  1. Semantic Versioning: Ideal for continuously developing projects like libraries.
  2. Date based Versioning: Perfect for projects with periodic updates or fixed schedules, facilitating chronological organization of revisions.


Changelog page

Design Version automatically generates a changelog page within your Figma project, documenting all the changes made. This allows any team member to access and review modifications in a structured and orderly manner.



BENEFITS ⭐


Enhanced Collaboration

Facilitates understanding of design changes and decisions among team members.


Increased Efficiency

Reduces time spent searching for and understanding past revisions.


Complete Control

Maintains a comprehensive and accessible history of design evolutions, ensuring that no important detail is missed.
plugins.tagline: Optimize your workflow: document changes, manage libraries, and enhance communication!

plugins.name: Camera Creator
plugins.description:
Creates a top-down representation of a camera’s horizontal field of view, based on the lens’s focal length and camera’s sensor size.


By default, the plugin assumes a full-frame/35mm film equivalent sensor size. This can be adjusted by changing the sensor width under the “More options” dropdown.


The distance of the rendered viewcone, and the camera icon dimensions, are adjustable in pixels to fit whatever scale your drawing uses.

plugins.name: ConvertMonkey - Import & Convert vector files to Figma - pdf, ai, eps & more
plugins.description:
ConvertMonkey - Your Vector File spirit animal for Figma

Hey vector lovers! 🐒 Tired of the hassle converting your favorite vector files to use in Figma? We feel you! That's why we created ConvertMonkey - your one-click solution to import EPS, PDF, AI, DXF, DWG & CDR files directly into Figma.


Why Go Bananas Over File Conversion?

Simply drag & drop your files, and watch ConvertMonkey work its magic. No more jumping between applications or losing vector quality in the process. Keep your designs crisp and professional, just as they should be!


Features

  1. One-click conversion
  2. Maintains vector quality
  3. Supports multiple file formats (PDF, EPS, AI, DXF, DWG, CDR)
  4. See fonts used in converted files
  5. Fast & easy


Coming Soon

We're working hard to make ConvertMonkey even more awesome! Here's what's cooking:


  1. Export FROM Figma to EPS, AI, PDF & more
  2. Raster image tracing (PNG, JPG, WEBP)
  3. Font flattening & curve conversion
  4. Support for adobe XD formats
  5. Ability to import websites to Figma


Got a feature in mind? We'd love to hear it! Our little monkey is always eager to learn new tricks.


Need Help?

Check out our video tutorials and documentation at https://iwan-web.com/convert-monkey


Found a bug? Have suggestions? We'd love to hear from you! Drop us a line at info@iwan-web.com - we're always excited to make ConvertMonkey better for our amazing community.


Cheers,

Island Web Apps Team

plugins.name: CSV Populate
plugins.description:
Populate your CSV data to text layers and automatically generate new elements.


How it works


* Create or export a CSV file with your favorite tool and upload it

* Rename your text layers accordingly to your CSV headers with a "#" suffix where you want the data to be applied

* Select the top level of the element you want to clone and the plugin to search for text layers

* Hit the Populate button


Supported objects


* Frames

* Groups

* Components

* Instances

* Text layers


Limitations


* The plugin currently only supports changes in text layers


Feel free to buy me a coffee ☕️

accepted.name: Eddy Salzmann
accepted.description: Product Designer with a passion for design tools and work optimization

plugins.name: Vector Fields
plugins.description:
Vector Fields is a generative tool that helps you play, tinker, and hack together patterns made from shapes.


Make visually stunning graphics by playing with different vector field presets.


Use dots, lines, arrows, triangles or even custom SVGS to create... stuff.


Some tips:

  • When you select a frame, the plugin will automatically adjust the SVG you're building to fit. If it has a background color, it will also use it!
  • Selecting any vector on your page will use it in the pattern which makes it easy to create new ideas.
  • Upload a custom SVG by selecting "custom shape" under the shape dropdown and paste your svg in.
  • Use the reset button to undo any changes you've made.
  • Play with the column and row counts, anything over 100 will make your computer chug so just be patient when rendering!


There may be some bugs so let me know if you run into any! Also feel free to request features! <3

accepted.name: Daniel Destefanis
accepted.description:
Design at @figma
Prev design at @discord

Creator of a few figma plugins, musician,  and most importantly a dad.

plugins.tagline: Generate patterns, vector fields, and general chaos with svgs

plugins.name: Icomoon to Figma Components
plugins.description:
Generate icon components from an Icomoon project.


Tutorial

https://youtu.be/H4QF4VqX_Lg


Import Icomoon Icons as Components

Before you begin, the .ttf font exported with your Icomoon project must first be installed as a system font.


All you will need is selection.json (exported with your Icomoon project). Run the plugin, import selection.json, then click Build Components to build out all components for each icon in the set.


As icons are added to your Icomoon project, rerun the plugin with selection.json and it will add only new icons it finds. You will need to reinstall the .ttf font when updates are made to your font.


Notes on Installing Icomoon’s Exported .ttf Font

Because the components use the text glyph of the font, you will need the .ttf component installed as a system font as well as any other Figma user who will be using the components, e.g. from a team library.


The Figma desktop app will need to be restarted in between the installation or updating of system fonts.

plugins.name: Bunch Text Changer
plugins.description:
Change all visible unlocked text layers in selection to a new value in one go with this plugin


1. Select one or several text layers

2. Call the plugin

3. Paste or type a new value

4. Hit enter. Done!


• Plugin will change ALL nested text layers in selected groups, Components, Instances or Frames


• If all selected layers already have the same value, it will appear in the placeholder (handy for correcting typos)


• Input is preselected, so you can call the plugin and type right away


• Block some layers from changing by staring the layer name with minus sign


See demo and some details on working with plugins faster here: https://twitter.com/aswellasyouare/status/1161070905142984704

plugins.name: Figma Variable Explorer
plugins.description:
Figma Variable Explorer

This plugin provides a centralized location for viewing Figma variables in both development and design modes. It allows users to access variables in three formats: "List," "JSON," and "CSS." Users can view and copy variables as needed.


List View

The simplest view displays all variables, their values, collections, and modes. You can show/hide collections and click alias values to access the linked variable. You can also search your variables by name, value in this mode.


CSS View

plugins.name: Export PDF
plugins.description:
Export PDF

Export your selected artboards into a High-Quality PDF—fast, reliable, and totally free !


The plugin exports artboards faster and efficient way. All the backend process is done locally, user data is not stored anywhere.


How to use Export PDF plugin :

1) Select Frames/Artboards you wish to export in the pdf. (Make sure you have your artboards renamed in the order you want)

2) Click on "Export PDF", the plugin status will give you update on the process.

3) Popup will ask you to save PDF at your desired location in local system. By default pdf name will be the same as your figma file name.

4) Relaunch export pdf plugin option will be shown on figma property panel on the right hand side.

plugins.name: Mimic CSS Shadows
plugins.description:
Apply Shadows from CSS!


This plugin lets you paste a box-shadow value from CSS and instantly apply it to objects in Figma. Say goodbye to manually inputting all the values for complex shadow effects!


How it works

  1. Use the Developer tools in your browser to get a box-shadow value (Guide)
  2. Paste it into the plugin
  3. Select the layers you want to have this shadow
  4. Click the Apply Shadow button


Note on Shadow Spread


Figma only supports spread on “simple” shapes (See here). This plugin will clip contents on any selected frames if the shadow has a spread value. Vectors, Stars, and other complex shapes won’t have the spread value applied.


Limitations

The plugin doesn't support non pixel values. It also doesn't support relative values like 'em' or CSS variables as these rely on css outside the code snippet.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly recreate shadows from the web!

plugins.name: Android Pixel Density Export Settings
plugins.description:
This is a utility plugin that applies the export settings for different pixel density sizes on Android. You can read the documentation in the link below around why density independent pixels are used to support multiple devices. 

https://developer.android.com/training/multiscreen/screendensities

How to Use 

1. Select the frame containing the asset you'd like to export
2. Press `command + /` or search for `Android Pixel Density Export Settings` in the Plugins menu
3. Run the plugin
4. Export settings should be prefilled 

All credit goes to @brian (Brian Lovin) whose plugin (iOS Export Settings) gave me the initial idea and also allowed me to fork his repo on GitHub and tweak a few values to publish this plugin.

Feel free to ping me on Twitter @justinmfarrugia if you have any questions or ideas around how I can extend this plugin.

plugins.name: Theme Switcher
plugins.description:
Figma Theme Switcher allows you to easily switch between two color styles applied to selected layers.


How It Works


Figma Theme Switcher finds matching set of color styles based on the user input and "switch" between them.

For example, if you want to switch theme from Light to Dark, type in "Light" for current input and "Dark" for target input then click "Switch". All of the selected layers will then be switched to the targeted "Dark" theme.

Keywords are not limited to Light/Dark and can be anywhere in the color style name.


  • Light/Text/Primary => Dark/Text/Primary
  • Text/Primary (Light) => Text/Primary (Dark)
  • V1/Text/Primary => V2/Text/Primary


Figma Theme Switcher even works with external color styles by saving them inside the plugin storage.


Basic Usage (Local Color Styles)


If your color styles are in your current file, follow steps below.


  1. Run Figma Theme Switcher
  2. Select layers
  3. Type in part of color styles name which describes a set of themes in current and target field (e.g. Light/Dark)
  4. Click "Switch"


Advanced Usage (External Color Styles)


If your color styles are in a different file (or library), follow steps below.


  1. Open a Figma file that has target color styles defined
  2. Run Figma Theme Switcher
  3. Switch to "Library Color Styles" tab
  4. Click "Save Color Styles from current file"
  5. Select layers
  6. Type in part of color styles name which describes a set of themes in current and target field (e.g. Light/Dark)
  7. Click "Switch"


Acknowledgments


Figma Theme Switcher is inspired by these awesome plugins.

  • https://github.com/rei-suzuki/figma-dark-mode-switcher
  • https://github.com/glmrvn/Appearance-figma-plugin


Support


figma-plugins-info@mail.yahoo.co.jp
plugins.tagline: Easily switch between two color styles applied to selected layers.

plugins.name: NavBoo!
plugins.description:
Introducing Navboo! – Your Ultimate Figma Plugin for Effortless Navbar Design

Navboo! offers a variety of pre-designed navbar templates, all equipped with Auto Layout, to streamline your design process in Figma. Here's how to get started:


**Installation**

  1. Open Figma and head to the Community tab.
  2. Search for "Navboo!" and install the plugin.
  3. Access Navboo! from the Plugins menu within your Figma project.
  4. Customize your navbar with ease, and let Auto Layout handle the rest.


**Using Navboo!**

  1. Open Navboo! from the Plugins menu in Figma.
  2. Select from a variety of navbar templates, each designed with Auto Layout.
  3. Customize the template to match your design preferences, including the ability to choose the number of menu items (from 1 to 10).
  4. Watch as your navbar is automatically generated and easily adjustable.

Best of all, it’s entirely free! Navboo! simplifies navigation design, making it a breeze to create and customize.


**Advantages**

  • User-Friendly: Navboo! is intuitively designed for ease of use.
  • Customization: Tailor your navbar to match your design preferences effortlessly.
  • Auto Layout: Ensure responsiveness across devices with Navboo!'s Auto Layout feature.
  • Variety of Designs: Choose from numerous themes to give your navbar a unique touch.
  • Flexible Menu Options: Select the number of menu items (from 1 to 10) to fit your needs.
  • Free to Use: Navboo! comes at no cost, empowering you to design without limitations.


**FAQ**

Q: Is Navboo! free to use?

A: Yes, Navboo! is completely free.


Q: Can I customize the navbar design?

A: Absolutely! Navboo! offers extensive customization options.


Q: Does Navboo! support Auto Layout?

A: Yes, Navboo! seamlessly integrates Auto Layout for responsive navbars.


Q: How do I install Navboo!?

A: Simply search for "Navboo!" in the Figma Community tab and install the plugin.


**About Us**

Have questions or suggestions? We're here to help!


Developed by:

- uipastel

- uixryan.png


Navboo! – Redefining navbar design in Figma. Let’s elevate your designs together!


**Documentation**

See Documentation!


------------------------------------------------------------------


Stay tuned for future updates with more models and variations of navbar designs!

plugins.name: AmourM - Website URL to Design, UI/UX Library, AI Design Generator & UI/UX Library Kit
plugins.description:
Features

  1. Website URL to Figma: This feature allows users to input a website URL and have the contents turned into an editable format within Figma, a popular design tool. This can be particularly useful for redesigning existing web pages or for quickly starting a design based on a live website.
  2. UI/UX Library Kit: A collection of design elements and components that can be used to build user interfaces. This saves time and ensures consistency across different parts of the application or website.
  3. Create Design with AI: AmourM uses artificial intelligence to help users create designs. This could mean generating design options based on certain parameters or assisting in the design process by automating repetitive tasks.
  4. Turn Design to Code: This is a feature that converts visual designs into code, such as HTML/CSS/React or other programming languages, which can be a huge time-saver and reduce the effort required to turn a design concept into a functioning website or app.


More Information

AmourM (ProjectABCs) is a robust tool suite tailored for web and app design professionals. It revolutionizes the design process by converting website URLs into editable Figma files, enabling swift redesigns or iterations. The platform boasts a rich UI/UX library kit with components from top designers, streamlining design consistency and workflow.


Leveraging AI, AmourM empowers designers to rapidly generate and iterate designs, blending creativity with AI efficiency. This feature accelerates the design cycle, providing a competitive edge in a fast-paced market.


The platform's standout feature, turning designs into code, epitomizes the seamless transition from concept to deployment, enhancing the collaboration between designers and developers. AmourM is a complete ecosystem, from concept to code, designed to elevate digital creations.


Discover more explore latest updates on X (Twitter) at https://mutraf.studio."
plugins.tagline: AmourM: Figma conversion, UI/UX kits, AI design, and code generation.

plugins.name: Layer Renamer
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you keep your layer names in order. Simply set it up and rename your layers with a single click.


How does it work?


Open the settings and:

  1. Enable the types of layers you want to rename using the switcher;
  2. Define default names for your layers;
  3. Enable «Rename always» if you want to rename this layer type every time. By default, it will only be renamed if the layer has the default name (frame, group, etc.).


Select the layers you want to rename and click on «Rename Layers».
plugins.tagline: Easy way to keep your layers names fine

plugins.name: office.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import PowerPoint, Word, Keynote, Pages and more...
plugins.description:
Import any office document as fully editable Figma designs.

Convert Word docs, PowerPoint presentations, Apple Keynote and more office documents into Figma designs!


Here are the major file formats currently supported:

  1. Microsoft PowerPoint (.pot, .potx, .ppt, .pptm, .pptx, .pps, .ppsx)
  2. Microsoft Word (.doc, .docm, .docx, .dotx, .dot)
  3. Apple Keynote and Pages (.key, .pages)
  4. OpenOffice, StarOffice and OpenDocument (.odp, .odt)
  5. Microsoft Works (.wps)
  6. WordPerfect (.wpd)
  7. AbiWord (.abw, .zabw)
  8. Lotus Word Pro (.lwp)
  9. Hangul Word Processor (.hwp)


How to import office documents into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, office.to.design
  2. Upload your file, or drag-and-drop it into the plugin
  3. Click “Import”
  4. Your document will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use office.to.design?

  1. Bring any type of document right into Figma.
  2. Fast, high-quality conversion from Microsoft Office to Figma, OpenOffice to Figma, Apple Pages to Figma, and more.
  3. Use old, but relevant files for new designs!


FREE

  1. 5 imports/month
  2. Imports as editable layers: First 3 pages only


PRO License

  1. Full features, multiple files at once and unlimited imports
  2. $49 for 1-year (not recurring)

or

  1. $99 for 3-years (not recurring)


------------------------------

Brought to you by ‹div›RIOTS

💬 Chat with us

------------------------------

plugins.name: Color2Code
plugins.description:
This plugin exports color variables into iOS & Android code format and also exports as Xcode Color Assets.


Features

------------------------------------------

  • Exports iOS code format
  • Exports Xcode Color assets
  • Exports Android code format (Compose & XML)
  • Supports variable mode (Light/Dark & High Contrast modes)
  • Customize exported variable name
  • Works in Dev Mode


⚠️ Important Note

------------------------------------------

Before exporting color assets;

  • You should rename your modes' names to "Light" and "Dark."
  • The names for the high contrast modes should be "Light High Contrast" and "Dark High Contrast."



Variable

primary-color: #18B968;


Output for iOS

let primaryColor: UIColor = UIColor(UIColor(red: 24, green: 185, blue: 104))


Output for Android Compose

val primaryColor = Color(0xff18b968)


Output for Android XML

<color name="primaryColor">#ff18b968</color>


How to use

  1. Launch the plugin
  2. Select your collection
  3. Hit the “Generate” button
  4. Copy code format


Exporting Xcode Color Assets

  1. Enable "Export Xcode Color Assets" option
  2. Hit the “Generate” button
  3. Download fileName_Colors.zip file
  4. Drag and drop the folders in Xcode's Assets.xcassets


Customization

  • Remove group names: Removes group name from the variable name.
  • Camel case naming: Removes space, dash, and underscore from the variable name.
  • Ignore hierarchy: Available for exporting Xcode color assets. Ignores group hierarchy and creates color assets at the same level. If you have variables with the same name, this will export only one of them!
  • Color Space: Available for exporting Xcode color assets. Display P3, sRGB, Extended Range sRGB, and Extended Range Linear sRGB options are supported.
  • Input Method: Available for exporting Xcode color assets. Floating Point (0.0-0.1), 8-bit (0-255), and 8-bit Hexadecimal formats are supported.
  • Any Appearance: Available for exporting Xcode color assets.


------------------------------------------

For support

Buy me a coffee

------------------------------------------

accepted.description:

plugins.name: Page Numbers
plugins.description:
Follow a simple layer naming convention, and pagination is easy! Absolute design freedom.


Have as many page numbers on a page as you want. No rules about using components.


Basic usage:

  1. Design your page numbers however you want, using placeholder numbers.
  2. Make sure every layer containing a page number is named page number.
  3. Select all the slides or frames.
  4. Run the plugin.


If you're not using Slides:

  1. Every page has to be framed (the whole page, not the page number layer).
  2. Arrange the pages in rows, left to right.


To see the advanced options, check out the readme.


For feature requests, bug reports, or questions, contact Mojave Interactive. Free and open source under the GPL 3.0 license.
plugins.tagline: Powerful pagination for presentation decks, memos, and books.

plugins.name: Export Styles and variables to CSS
plugins.description:
Displays all variables and styles from all collections in a developer-friendly format, either in JSON or as CSS variables


There are 3 available modes of operation:

  1. Output of all Figma variables
  2. Output of all Figma styles
  3. Output of styles for the currently selected element


For the selected layer, the following will be displayed:

  1. all its CSS styles;
  2. If the layer is textual, then the text for easy copying;
  3. if the layer has a background image, then a button for exporting the original image.

If 2 layers are selected - the dimensions of the layers and the distance between them


The code can be generated in the following formats:

  1. CSS
  2. JSON


Encountering difficulties? Feel free to contact us; we will always try to help.

plugins.name: WCAG Plugin
plugins.description:
This plugin enhances the accessibility of digital designs by integrating accessibility guidelines directly into your design processes and systems. The WCAG Plugin offers three key features:


🔎 Guideline Search - Quickly find relevant guidelines as a conversation starter and to ensure your designs are providing an equitable experience for all users.


🗂️ Notation Cards - Annotate Figma design files with WCAG guideline cards to increase your knowledge of accessibility requirements and best practices.


🔧 Utility Tokens - Import accessibility utility tokens as Figma variables to ensure accessible design decisions across various design elements and components.


Free and open-source:

This plugin is free and open-source, driven by a community of passionate contributors dedicated to making digital design more accessible for everyone.


Roadmap:

We are incredibly grateful for the enthusiastic support and feedback from our community. Your input has been invaluable in shaping the future of this plugin. Here’s what’s coming next:


New in Version 4:


  • Filter by Version: Easily find guidelines based on specific WCAG versions.
  • Filter by Level: Quickly access guidelines categorized by conformance levels (A, AA, AAA).


Ideas Added to our Backlog:


  • Plain Language Explanations (WCAG Quotes): Simplified, user-friendly interpretations of the WCAG guidelines to enhance understanding and accessibility for all.
  • Interactive Tutorials: Step-by-step guides and interactive walkthroughs to help users apply accessibility guidelines directly in their designs.
  • Customizable Notation Cards: Allow users to add custom notes and highlight specific guidelines directly within Figma.
  • Community Showcase: A platform to highlight exemplary accessible designs created by the community, fostering inspiration and sharing best practices.
  • Localized Guideline Support: Provide translations and culturally relevant examples of WCAG guidelines to support a global user base.


We need your ideas and feedback:

Stay involved by visiting our Feedback page to share your thoughts and ideas. Together, we can continue to improve and make digital design more inclusive.
plugins.tagline: Search and drop accessibility cards into your design files.
